question: There is a problem in your street. Write a letter to the local town council explaining who you are, what the problem is and what you hope will be done about it.
text: My name is Sarah Roberts, and I am writing to you regarding a tree that fell down on Martin Street, York, on 4th March.

For the reason of the last storm we had many damages in our neighbourhood. Specifically a tree that fell down, and it is being blocked the road. The episode happened on the right-hand side of the street. More specific in front of the house 508, Martin Street.

In the day that occurred the issue I called the fire department immediately, but have not had any success. I completely understand they are very busy, also there are many issues all over the city. However, it has been almost a week and the problem was not solved yet.
I would be grateful if you could send the maintenance to remove the tree by the end of this week.
I look forward to hearing from you.
